column2: MARYLAND PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: rectangle shaped.

column2: 2. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.
column8: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.

column2: 3. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 4. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.

column2: 5. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column8: a speed limit sign.

column2: 6. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column6: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 8. Your license can be suspended if you are under 21 and drive with a BAC of:
column8: any amount.

column2: 9. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column8: Open intersection ahead

column2: 11. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 12. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column8: Brake lightly.

column2: 13. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Watch for vehicles entering from the side
column8: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed

column2: 15. The only effective way to reduce your blood alcohol content (BAC) is:
column6: not to drink over a period of time.
column8: fresh air.

column2: 16. This road sign tells drivers that:
column6: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column8: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 17. Give the right-of-way to any pedestrian:
column6: if you have the green light.
column8: on the opposite side of the street.

column2: 18. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column6: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column8: you are not wearing safety belts.

column2: 19. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column8: help create a safe driving environment.

column2: 20. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 21. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a side road.

column2: 22. Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
column8: brake failure.

column2: 23. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column6: The light will soon change from green to red.
column8: Drive with caution.

column2: 24. Blind spots are:
column4: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 25. When driving at night, drivers should:
column6: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.
column8: increase their following distance.
